channel.title: [PI] 317 NPC Dialogue After Option chose Not showing up! (probably easy fix)

item.title: [PI] 317 NPC Dialogue After Option chose Not showing up! (probably easy fix)
item.dc:creator: @deathe1000 deathe1000
item.description:
@deathe1000 wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:4, topic:555417”]In the code you just posted, I don’t see the dialogueAction 11 anywhere?

And yes, I see your “problem.”

It’s right here:

c.dialogueAction = 0; c.getPA().removeAllWindows(); break;

If you kept your code the same as what you originally posted in the first post, then this is your issue.

This would be why:

if (c.dialogueAction == 11) {// The dialogueAction is 11. Therefore, it sends this dialogue c.sendNpcDialogues(30, 252); //my next dialogue for the same NPC // Since there is no "break" or "return" here, the code continues to the next line(s). Since all your other code checks for other dialogues, it'll "skip" right to the bottom.. } //AKA: this: c.dialogueAction = 0;// this sets your action back to 0. c.getPA().removeAllWindows();// and this closes any open window, including a dialogue. So your dialogue may be activating for a whole .05 of a second. break;[/quote]

In the code I just posted, I copied the code after I took the dialogueAction == 11 statement out. I just was showing what was on there

I fixed it, though. Thanks for the help, man

Read full topic
item.source: [PI] 317 NPC Dialogue After Option chose Not showing up! (probably easy fix)

item.title: [PI] 317 NPC Dialogue After Option chose Not showing up! (probably easy fix)
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

In the code you just posted, I don’t see the dialogueAction 11 anywhere?

And yes, I see your “problem.”

It’s right here:

c.dialogueAction = 0; c.getPA().removeAllWindows(); break;

If you kept your code the same as what you originally posted in the first post, then this is your issue.

This would be why:

if (c.dialogueAction == 11) {// The dialogueAction is 11. Therefore, it sends this dialogue c.sendNpcDialogues(30, 252); //my next dialogue for the same NPC // Since there is no "break" or "return" here, the code continues to the next line(s). Since all your other code checks for other dialogues, it'll "skip" right to the bottom.. } //AKA: this: c.dialogueAction = 0;// this sets your action back to 0. c.getPA().removeAllWindows();// and this closes any open window, including a dialogue. So your dialogue may be activating for a whole .05 of a second. break;

item.title: [PI] 317 NPC Dialogue After Option chose Not showing up! (probably easy fix)
item.dc:creator: @deathe1000 deathe1000
item.description:
@deathe1000 wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:2, topic:555417”]the issue could lie in "the rest of the case, which i did not include"
because you didn’t not add a return statement in your code.

case 9157: //tele to barrows tunnel if (c.dialogueAction == 11) { c.sendNpcDialogues(30, 252); //my next dialogue for the same NPC c.dialogueAction = -1; return; } //then the rest of the case, which I did not include
Something like this may help.

If it doesn’t you can add in a system.out statement to make sure the case is actually being reached in your code:

case 9157: //tele to barrows tunnel System.out.println("Button clicked"); if (c.dialogueAction == 11) { c.sendNpcDialogues(30, 252); //my next dialogue for the same NPC c.dialogueAction = -1; return; } //then the rest of the case, which I did not include[/quote]

Here is the rest of the case:

[code]case 9157://barrows tele to tunnels
if(c.dialogueAction == 1) {
int r = 4;
//int r = Misc.random(3);
switch® {
case 0:
c.getPA().movePlayer(3534, 9677, 0);
break;

					case 1:
						c.getPA().movePlayer(3534, 9712, 0);
						break;
					
					case 2:
						c.getPA().movePlayer(3568, 9712, 0);
						break;
					
					case 3:
						c.getPA().movePlayer(3568, 9677, 0);
						break;
					case 4:
						c.getPA().movePlayer(3551, 9694, 0);
						break;
				}
			} else if (c.dialogueAction == 2) {
				c.getPA().movePlayer(2507, 4717, 0);		
			} else if (c.dialogueAction == 5) {
				c.getSlayer().giveTask();
			} else if (c.dialogueAction == 6) {
				c.getSlayer().giveTask2();
			} else if (c.dialogueAction == 7) {
				c.getPA().startTeleport(3088,3933,0,"modern");
				c.sendMessage("NOTE: You are now in the wilderness...");
			} else if (c.dialogueAction == 8) {
				c.getPA().fixAllBarrows();
			} else if (c.dialogueAction == 13) {
				if (c.getItems().playerHasItem(995,200)) {
					c.getItems().deleteItem(995,c.getItems().getItemSlot(995), 200);
					c.itemBeforeCarpet = c.playerEquipment[c.playerWeapon];
					c.playerEquipment[c.playerWeapon] = 5614;
					c.getPA().movePlayer(3308, 3109, 0);
					c.startAnimation(2262);
					c.isRunning2 = true;
					c.usingCarpet = true;
					c.getPA().walkTo3(-130, -64);
					c.getCombat().getPlayerAnimIndex(c.getItems().getItemName(c.playerEquipment[c.playerWeapon]).toLowerCase());
					c.updateRequired = true; 
					c.setAppearanceUpdateRequired(true);
				} else {
				c.sendMessage("You need 200 coins to ride the carpet.");
				}	
			} else if (c.usingGamesNeck) {
				c.getPA().startTeleport2(2899, 3565, 0);
			} else if (c.usingROD) {
				c.getPA().startTeleport(3314, 3234, 0, "modern");
			}
			c.dialogueAction = 0;
			c.getPA().removeAllWindows();
			break;[/code]

Any problems with it that you see?

Oh yeah, I added a forcedChat to see if the button was clicked and it was - the forcedChat worked but not the sendDialogues!

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] 317 NPC Dialogue After Option chose Not showing up! (probably easy fix)
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

the issue could lie in "the rest of the case, which i did not include"
because you didn’t not add a return statement in your code.

case 9157: //tele to barrows tunnel if (c.dialogueAction == 11) { c.sendNpcDialogues(30, 252); //my next dialogue for the same NPC c.dialogueAction = -1; return; } //then the rest of the case, which I did not include
Something like this may help.

If it doesn’t you can add in a system.out statement to make sure the case is actually being reached in your code:

case 9157: //tele to barrows tunnel System.out.println("Button clicked"); if (c.dialogueAction == 11) { c.sendNpcDialogues(30, 252); //my next dialogue for the same NPC c.dialogueAction = -1; return; } //then the rest of the case, which I did not include

item.title: [PI] 317 NPC Dialogue After Option chose Not showing up! (probably easy fix)
item.dc:creator: @deathe1000 deathe1000
item.description:
@deathe1000 wrote:

Hey guys, so recently I started adding a few more NPCs into the game with intentions to add some dialogue that I would model my quest with. Here is what I have so far. I have dialogue that works fine, and options that work fine, but when I try to start dialogue back up from clicking an option, it doesn’t show!
[SIZE=5]
[B]PROBLEM:[/B][/SIZE] In clickingbuttons, when the option from dialogue is chosen, everything works, except c.sendNPCDialogues(#, #) is not working and does not send dialgoue!

Here is my NPC that I spawned in spawn-config

Here is my dialogue cases for this NPC:

case 27: sendNpcChat4("Hey...","You're an adventurer, right...?","I may have something that you want...","Do you want me to tell you how to get it?", c.talkingNpc, "Mysterious man"); c.nextChat = 28; break; case 28: sendNpcChat4("So, the only catch is this:", "The sword I will be giving you in the end", "is very powerful, but only works", "for those who have overcome a curse.", c.talkingNpc, "Mysterious man"); c.nextChat = 29; break; case 29: sendOption2("Tell me how to get it", "I'm not interested"); c.dialogueAction = 11; break; case 30: //the case I want to appear when they choose the first option! c.sendNpcChat1("Sounds good, I will tell you.", c.talkingNpc, "Mysterious Man"); c.nextChat = 31; break;

Then, in actionHandler to start the dialogue I have, under firstClickNPC:

case 252:
		c.getDH().sendDialogues(27, npcType);
		break;

The dialogue works fine, my only problem is, after they select an option, getting a dialogue to come back. Here is my clickingButtons for option 1 (“Tell me how to get it”) which gave me the ID of [COLOR="#FFFF00"]9157[/COLOR]

case 9157: //tele to barrows tunnel
if (c.dialogueAction == 11) {
c.sendNpcDialogues(30, 252); //my next dialogue for the same NPC
}
//then the rest of the case, which I did not include

The only thing about this is when it calls this case and the dialogueAction number, it doesn’t send the dialogue. I even tried putting a test there such as c.forcedChat(“TEST”); and even THAT showed up, but the sendDialogue doesn’t show up. I also checked and 11 is not used as a dialogueAction anywhere. I know it is calling case 9157 @ dialogue action 11, but not sure why sendNpcDialogues isn’t working.

If anyone could help me, it’d be greatly appreciated. Will rep anyone who can help!

Read full topic
item.source: [PI] 317 NPC Dialogue After Option chose Not showing up! (probably easy fix)
